Volunteering can have such a positive effect on our mental health! Believe in the power of giving back to your community. Volunteer and make a positive impact. ğŸ¤ Whether it's spending time at a local shelter, helping out at a food bank, or simply lending a hand to someone in need, volunteering can be incredibly rewarding. It not only benefits others but also boosts our own mental well-being. ğŸŒŸ Together, we can create a ripple effect of kindness and compassion. ğŸ’™ Remember, taking care of ourselves and supporting others go hand in hand. Let's make this mental health day count! ğŸŒˆ #MentalHealthDay #SelfCare #Volunteering #GivingBack #CommunityMatters

Setting your resolutions for 2024? Are you a giving local who can use food or creativity to connect with others? We have limited slots for programs using creativity or food-to bring people together. Think sushi rolling, paint-and-sip, dumpling-making, flower arranging and much more! WHY VOLUNTEER? A venue with a purpose "The philosophy of the Foundation is genuine, and the space at Summer Hill is warm, friendly and inviting." It is a warm and inviting space "It is also a beautiful space, not simply a bland hall or meeting room. Itâ€™s a stimulating and welcoming environment." Support, training and collaboration "The training sessions are wonderful. Theyâ€™re an opportunity for volunteers to network and link up and meet each other. The mental health training is invaluable â€“ especially about combatting loneliness." Easy to get started "I volunteer because itâ€™s on my doorstep and the team make it easy." Enquire though our website: https://lnkd.in/g-ERH5cf The Little BIG Foundation aims to reduce loneliness by inspiring communities to connect better. It was founded by and receives ongoing support from EG Funds. #givingback #newyearsresolution #goals #volunteer

ğŸŒŸ The Power of Community Service: Why It Matters ğŸŒŸ Hey LinkedIn Fam! ğŸ™Œ Ever thought about how much impact a single act of kindness can make? Serving our community is more than just a good deed; it's a way to build connections, spread joy, and create lasting change. Here's why YOU should get involved: 1. Build Stronger Connections: Volunteering brings people together. Whether it's helping at a local shelter, participating in a clean-up drive, or mentoring kids, you'll meet amazing individuals and form lasting friendships. ğŸ‘¥â¤ï¸ 2. Boost Your Well-being: Helping others isn't just good for the community; it's great for your mental health too! The sense of fulfillment and happiness you get from making a difference is unbeatable. ğŸ˜Šâœ¨ 3. Learn and Grow: Community service is a fantastic way to develop new skills and gain fresh perspectives. You'll learn so much about yourself and the world around you. ğŸ“šğŸŒ 4. Inspire Change: Your actions can inspire others to get involved. Imagine the ripple effect of kindness spreading throughout your community! ğŸŒŠğŸ’« So, let's roll up our sleeves and make a difference together. Every small effort counts. Let's turn our good intentions into great actions. ğŸŒŸğŸ’ª #TeamOCMentors #CommunityService #GiveBack #MakeADifference #StrongerTogether #SpreadKindness

Building Community Awareness and Support It's critical to create a supportive community environment that recognizes and responds to the mental health needs of its youth. Understanding and collaboration from every community member can significantly impact young individuals' lives. Community Workshops: Hold events to educate the community on mental health issues and how to offer support. Public Awareness Campaigns: Use local media and social platforms to spread awareness and reduce stigma. School-Community Partnerships: Schools should partner with local organizations to provide comprehensive support services. Volunteer Programs: Encourage community involvement through volunteer programs aimed at supporting youth and families. Strengthening community support systems ensures no one navigates mental health challenges in isolation. For ways to get involved or create community-driven support initiatives, visit www.gymha.org. #GYMHA #CommunitySupport #AwarenessCampaigns #VolunteerSupport

FACTS ABOUT VOLUNTEERING Volunteering can help improve mental health by giving you feelings of gratitude for what you have in your own life, Volunteering can help you come up with your own creative ideas for new ways to volunteer People who volunteer and have this to write on their CVs are much more likely of finding work than those who do not. Volunteering can help counteract the effects of stress, anger, and anxiety,it also combat depression. Join the volunteer plug today to make an impact If you are looking for where to volunteer to build your skills, then you should join our Telegram group where we share volunteer opportunities twice a week. Click the link in bio to join. #volunteeringfact #buildyourskills #volunteersinnigeria #socialimpactspace #thevolunteerplug

This month, our regional well-being initiative is centered on community well-being and thriving teams. In May, Marsh McLennan Agency and all Marsh McLennan companies observe Global Volunteer Month! Not only does volunteering and giving back help others, volunteer activities can have a positive effect on physical and mental health, and promote teamwork when done as a group. Read more statistics via Project Helping at the link. #WellbeingAtWork #MarshMMA #MMImpact
